title: Microsoft Internet Explorer CTableOMRowCache Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Microsoft Internet Explorer. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.
The vulnerability relates to how Internet Explorer keeps track of in-memory objects representing rows in an HTML table. By manipulating a document's elements an attacker can force a CTableRow object in memory to be reused after it has been freed. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code under the context of the current process.
addtionnal_details: Microsoft has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/MS14-052
timeline:
2014-07-07 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2014-09-16 - Coordinated public release of advisory
